intro: Linaria saturejoides var. flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered linaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders.
